intro: Fuirena primiera, commonly known as the common fuirena, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Fuirena primiera is often found in meadows and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
